item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 26, 2019: The Best of Tiny Desk + Aloha Got Soul
item.description: Paige Okamura selects her favorite artists that have performed on NPR Music's Tiny Desk Concert and is joined in the studio by Roger and Lei Bong of Aloha Got Soul.
item.itunes:summary: Paige Okamura selects her favorite artists that have performed on NPR Music's Tiny Desk Concert and is joined in the studio by Roger and Lei Bong of Aloha Got Soul.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 25nd, 2019: Down By The Water
item.description: Keeping the music mellow, cool and reflective for this Monday evening.
item.itunes:summary: Keeping the music mellow, cool and reflective for this Monday evening.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 22nd, 2019: New Music Discoveries
item.description: Taking that deep dive into new sounds this evening on Bridging the Gap. Super excited to be premiering new music from Quantic, Preservation Hall Brass Band, The Chemical Brothers and more.
item.itunes:summary: Taking that deep dive into new sounds this evening on Bridging the Gap. Super excited to be premiering new music from Quantic, Preservation Hall Brass Band, The Chemical Brothers and more.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 21st, 2019: Festival of Colors
item.description: Our DJ-in-training Harrison Patiño selects colorful songs to commerate the Hindu festival of light and love: Holi.
item.itunes:summary: Our DJ-in-training Harrison Patiño selects colorful songs to commerate the Hindu festival of light and love: Holi.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 20th, 2019: Spring
item.description: Happy Spring to you. Winter has offically finished... and we're headed for sun and warmer weather (by Hawaii standards). So this session of Bridging the Gap is going to be a collection of Spring inspired songs to ring in the season.
item.itunes:summary: Happy Spring to you. Winter has offically finished... and we're headed for sun and warmer weather (by Hawaii standards). So this session of Bridging the Gap is going to be a collection of Spring inspired songs to ring in the season.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 19th, 2019: Mele Hawai'i About Hawaii
item.description: Paige Okamura weaves together a selection of songs about the Valley Isle.
item.itunes:summary: Paige Okamura weaves together a selection of songs about the Valley Isle.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 18th, 2019: Surfing Session w/ Dick Dale
item.description: Celebrating the music of surf rock guitarist Dick Dale who passed on Saturday at the age of 81. It's also a great excuse to play other surf inspired songs that feature the late Hal Blaine, drummer for the wrecking crew who passed away last week.
item.itunes:summary: Celebrating the music of surf rock guitarist Dick Dale who passed on Saturday at the age of 81. It's also a great excuse to play other surf inspired songs that feature the late Hal Blaine, drummer for the wrecking crew who passed away last week.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 15th, 2019: NPR's Austin 100 (Part 2)
item.description: Tonight’s show is part 2 of a seriously deep dive into new music, taken from NPR Music’s Austin 100. A list that features up and coming acts performing at this years SXSW festival in Austin Texas. It’s been cherry picked.. but appears almost in order as it appears on their Spotify playlist. So I ask you to turn up the volume… open your ears to discovery and please any potential cursing that may come from these songs… and the fact that I’ll be breaking in a lot to introduce these artists with bios ripped from NPR Music.
item.itunes:summary: Tonight’s show is part 2 of a seriously deep dive into new music, taken from NPR Music’s Austin 100. A list that features up and coming acts performing at this years SXSW festival in Austin Texas. It’s been cherry picked.. but appears almost in order as it appears on their Spotify playlist. So I ask you to turn up the volume… open your ears to discovery and please any potential cursing that may come from these songs… and the fact that I’ll be breaking in a lot to introduce these artists with bios ripped from NPR Music.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 13th, 2019: NPR's Austin 100 (Part 1)
item.description: Tonight’s show is a seriously deep dive into new music, taken from NPR Music’s Austin 100. A list that features up and coming acts performing at this years SXSW festival in Austin Texas. It’s been cherry picked..
item.itunes:summary: Tonight’s show is a seriously deep dive into new music, taken from NPR Music’s Austin 100. A list that features up and coming acts performing at this years SXSW festival in Austin Texas. It’s been cherry picked..

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 14h, 2019: Indie Deep Dive
item.description: Our DJ-in-training Harrison Patiño takes a deep dive into different styles of indie rock (with a few more recognizable artists peppered in) on tonight's session of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: Our DJ-in-training Harrison Patiño takes a deep dive into different styles of indie rock (with a few more recognizable artists peppered in) on tonight's session of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 12th, 2019: 'Ole Moons
item.description: Paige Okamura weaves together a selection of songs designed to get you out of a funk... think: anti-retrograde music.
item.itunes:summary: Paige Okamura weaves together a selection of songs designed to get you out of a funk... think: anti-retrograde music.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 11th, 2019: Beats from the Rising Sun
item.description: This session of Bridging the Gap features mostly music from Japan. It's inspired by this picture of a 19th century model posed as Nakano Takeko, a female samurai from the Boshin war. Expect Downtempo, Jazz and a little Indie Rock.
item.itunes:summary: This session of Bridging the Gap features mostly music from Japan. It's inspired by this picture of a 19th century model posed as Nakano Takeko, a female samurai from the Boshin war. Expect Downtempo, Jazz and a little Indie Rock.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 8th, 2019: International Women's Day (2)
item.description: Celebrating International Women's Day for this Friday session of Bridging the Gap. Paige Okamura did this theme on Tuesday, and I'm just piggy-backing on the idea. Expect a mixture of indie rock, folk and soul all from female artists and trailblazers.
item.itunes:summary: Celebrating International Women's Day for this Friday session of Bridging the Gap. Paige Okamura did this theme on Tuesday, and I'm just piggy-backing on the idea. Expect a mixture of indie rock, folk and soul all from female artists and trailblazers.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 7th, 2019: Rock & World
item.description: Our DJ-in-training Harrison Patiño mixes together a set of indie rock and world music for tonight's session of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: Our DJ-in-training Harrison Patiño mixes together a set of indie rock and world music for tonight's session of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 6th, 2019: British Big Beat and Other Electronic Innovators
item.description: Earlier this week Keith Flint, the singer for The Prodigy passed away at the age of 49. Thought I'm really not a fan of their music, it did send me down memory lane for that period of somewhat cheesy electronic music, usually categorized as Big Beat. So tonight's show is going to be a mixture of Big Beat artists, a little Jungle and Trip-Hop all from the UK.
item.itunes:summary: Earlier this week Keith Flint, the singer for The Prodigy passed away at the age of 49. Thought I'm really not a fan of their music, it did send me down memory lane for that period of somewhat cheesy electronic music, usually categorized as Big Beat. So tonight's show is going to be a mixture of Big Beat artists, a little Jungle and Trip-Hop all from the UK.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 5th, 2019: International Women's Day
item.description: Paige Okamura celebrates International Women's Day with a selection of Soul, Hawaiian, World and Reggae.
item.itunes:summary: Paige Okamura celebrates International Women's Day with a selection of Soul, Hawaiian, World and Reggae.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 4th, 2019: Mardi Gras
item.description: Celebrating Fat Tuesday and Mardi Gras in this Bridging the Gap with a variety of music from the Big Easy. Expect 2nd Line brass, Mardi Gras Indians and a little Zydeco.
item.itunes:summary: Celebrating Fat Tuesday and Mardi Gras in this Bridging the Gap with a variety of music from the Big Easy. Expect 2nd Line brass, Mardi Gras Indians and a little Zydeco.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~March 1st, 2019: The Crash
item.description: So my computer crashed right before going into this show. So I scrapped my plans, and played older CDs. It still turned out to be a pretty good show, and can be found below.
item.itunes:summary: So my computer crashed right before going into this show. So I scrapped my plans, and played older CDs. It still turned out to be a pretty good show, and can be found below.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~February 28th, 2019: Indie Rock Excursion
item.description: HPR's newest DJ- Harrison Patiño stretches his legs with two hours of indie rock for this session of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: HPR's newest DJ- Harrison Patiño stretches his legs with two hours of indie rock for this session of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~February 27th, 2019: Soul, Funk & Brass
item.description: Celebrating the life of the late Jackie Shane, and exploring all sorts of soul, funk and brass driven music in this session of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: Celebrating the life of the late Jackie Shane, and exploring all sorts of soul, funk and brass driven music in this session of Bridging the Gap.
